item.title: Excellence is a habit, but so is failure
item.description: - Making small incremental improvements every day can lead to great things, but it's also important to recognize that incremental neglect and small missteps can accumulate and lead to negative outcomes.

item.title: Why I Hate Frameworks (2005)
item.description: - The author explores the concept of frameworks in software development and compares them to hammers in the context of building a spice rack.

item.title: 32" E Ink screen that displays daily newspapers on your wall (2021)
item.description: - Project E Ink is a $2500 e ink art piece that can display daily newspapers on your wall.

item.title: OpenWorm â€“ A computational model of C. elegans worm
item.description: - OpenWorm is aiming to build a computational model of a microscopic worm called Caenorhabditis elegans.

item.title: Meta releases Intermediate Graphics Library
item.description: - Meta has released a new open-source Intermediate Graphics Library (IGL) that provides developers with powerful tools for creating high-quality visuals and graphics in their applications.

item.title: Customers don't want chat bots
item.description: - CEO of OpenAI, Sam Altman, predicts that chat bots will replace human customer service representatives, leading to the elimination of certain jobs.

item.title: ProtonMail Rewrites Your Emails
item.description: - The ProtonMail Android client has been causing issues with sending complete emails, prompting the author to look for alternative email clients.

item.title: TypeScript please give us reflection/runtime types
item.description: - The post discusses the need for TypeScript to emit runtime type information in order to solve issues related to serialization and validation in real-world projects.

item.title: Windows Update Restored: Fix Windows update on Windows 95, 98, ME, 2000, & XP
item.description: - No main article is available on this page.

item.title: Show HN: OPML list of Hacker News Users Personal Blogs
item.description: - A collection of personal blogs from the Hacker News thread "Could you share your personal blog here?"
